relation: The University of Memphis has plenty of campus security, they even have their own campus police.
The University of Memphis is worth the money and tuition is not that expensive.
There is always something to do on the campus. They have talent shows, comedy shows, the rec (gym) and all sorts of fun events that they sponsor.
They have a very broad range of food places: Chick - fa- la, subway, burger king, Taco bell, fresh foods, just for you and others
They have many living facilities. Dorm life is cool especially for an incoming freshman. They are safe and reliable.
It really depends on the teacher's, but most teacher's like to give you difficult work so you can work your brain. It all pays off in the end.

Participate in campus activities. Get help if needed because there is plenty help around campus. Go to class. Be the best student you can be. Study! Study! Study! Get enough sleep, do not stay up late hanging out with friends!

1. The University of Memphis is a very active school, they want all of their students to participate in all the events that go on around the campus. 2. The help on this campus is amazing! 3. They want all of their students to succeed in life.
pageTitle: University of Memphis (U of M) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {54110=The campus is amazing. There are buildings for every department and the school is working on improving it's organization and curb-appeal. Recently a new parking lot was added, and though it has less parking spaces, there are plans for many more, as well as new/nicer buildings, finished by approx. 2016. There is a four-story library that has a bagel shop, so students and faculty may munch and read. There is ample seating area with some of the most comfortable chairs on campus. There are many places to eat, including healthy choices such as Subway and Chik-Fil-A. As well as these amazing things, however, are the excellent academic programs. There are qualified teachers in every department, and the undergraduate catalog includes a vast variety of majors, minors, and concentrations. What is particularly unique about the university is the wonderful music program, which is very extensive and not found in many schools., 188971=The Student Activities Council and Registered Student Organizations always have events going on, almost every day. In the Spring there's Spring Fling, in 2014 (the year before I was a student) Big Sean came to campus and performed for students for free!!, 611859=For students who believe they might find difficulty in transitioning from high school to college, this University offers the class â??ACAD 1100.â?? Taught by an admissions advisor, this class focuses on topics such as time-management and helpful study habits that have been proven to aid students transitioning from high school into college. For students who are coming into this University without a vehicle, the University offers a free means of transportation known as â??the Blue Line.â?? A bus line that travels around most of both the campus and city. For students who are normally stressed, the Counseling Center sponsors a fully interactive relaxation zone called the â??Relaxation Zone.â?? Comfy lounge chairs, couches, massage chairs and bean bags habitat the area. There, free massages are available along with a fully functioning sauna., 641399=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 90669=My journey with the University of Memphis began in July 2011 and has not failed yet. I went to Orientation and I grew to love it. I learned about the educational programs, but most of all I learned respect and humbleness.}

textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students 1.STUDY, STUDY, STUDY!!!! 2.Get enough sleep for class 3.Have a light snack or eat breakfast 4.Try to workout whenever possible-we have a free recreational facility for students to partake in a variety of exercises and sports---It's FREE with school ID- don't gain the FRESHMAN 15 5.Get a study group started or join one, every bit of studying will help with even the hardest class 6.keep a steady schedule so that you can still schedule other things you would like to do like spending time with family and friends or enjoying you favorite hobby. 7.if you work or would like to work make sure it does not interfere with school. I learned that the hard way but I fixed the mistake before it was too later 8. Take every scholarship opportunity available. College isn't cheap, and take it from me, you will not want to continue paying for school well after you graduate, many,many,many years late Bang for the buck The great thing about this school is you have the opportunity to drop classes if you feel uneasy, whether you really feel the class is not for you or whether you will fail the first test, you have the opportunity to redeem yourself before the deadline or just before its too late. there's also a wide range of food choices, so you'll never go hungry. Full-time (12+ hrs)
